adqlParser.parser
Class DefaultDBConsistency

java.lang.Object
  adqlParser.parser.DBConsistency
      adqlParser.parser.DefaultDBConsistency

public class DefaultDBConsistency
extends DBConsistency

This implementation of DBConsistency can't ensure the consistency with a "database" because it is not linked with any database. So a parser using an object of this class won't ensure the consistency with a database: only the syntax will be checked !

However columns name and table name may be checked IF an object of this class is created with checkExistence = true and IF you manage yourself columns and tables lists of DBConsistency with the appropriate functions.

Version:
06/2010
Author:
Grégory Mantelet (CDS)
See Also:
DBConsistency

check

Constructor Detail

DefaultDBConsistency

public DefaultDBConsistency()
Creates a DBConsistency which won't ensure any kind of consistency with a database.

DefaultDBConsistency

public DefaultDBConsistency(boolean checkExistence)
Creates a DBConsistency which will check columns and tables names. To succeed you will have to add yourself columns and tables (names and alias) thanks to the appropriate functions (see DBConsistency).

Parameters:
checkExistence - true to check column and table names, else false.
